parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: STUDYID
fields.questionText: What is the study identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SITEID
fields.questionText: What is the site identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SUBJID
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.VISIT

fields.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
fields.implementationNotes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.
fields.label: Visit Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: VISIT
fields.questionText: What is the visit name?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date of the physical examination can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the physical examination findings at that visit, or the collection date can be included collected on the PE CRF using the date (PEDAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable PEDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.PEPERF

fields.completionInstructions: If the physical examination was performed as planned, select Yes; otherwise, select No.
fields.definition: An indication of whether a planned physical examination was performed.
fields.implementationNotes: This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. Used to ask if the physical exam was performed at the overall subject level at the specified time point. If this field is used, the result should only be mapped to PESTAT if the overall examination (at the subject level) was not performed. If the overall examination was performed, then the value of PESTAT would be null for each examined body systems and "NOT DONE" for any body systems not examined (see PERES).
fields.label: Physical Examination Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable PESTAT. If PEPERF="N" the value of PESTAT="NOT DONE". If PEPERF="Y", then the actual physical exam results would be reported by body system (see PERES). PECAT, PESCAT, PETEST and PETESTCD must reflect what tests were not done. If used for an entire CRF or other set of multiple tests with PECAT and PESCAT, PETESTCD=PEALL.
fields.name: PEPERF
fields.questionText: Was the physical examination performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.PECAT

fields.completionInstructions: Select the physical examination category, or record if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. The CRF can capture different types of physical exams using PECAT (e.g., GENERAL, OPHTHAMOLOGIC, NEUROLOGICAL). This may be pre-printed on the CRF. If PECAT is not collected (e.g., it is evident from the protocol design), it could be populated when creating SDTM-based datasets.
fields.label: Category for Examination
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: PECAT
fields.questionText: What was the category of the physical examination?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.PESCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Select the physical examination subcategory, or record if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the PECAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. The CRF can capture the different subtypes of PE categories using PESCAT. This may be pre-printed on the CRF. If PESCAT is not collected (e.g. it is evident from the protocol design), it could be populated when creating SDTM-based datasets. PESCAT can only be used if there is a PECAT, and it must be a subcategorization of PECAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for Examination
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: PESCAT
fields.questionText: What was subcategory of the physical examination?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.PEDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record complete date of examination using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date when the physical examination was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The date of examination may be determined from the date of the visit (VISDAT); if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.
fields.label: Physical Examination Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PEDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: PEDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date of the physical examination?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.PETIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the time of examination (as complete as possible).
fields.definition: The time of examination, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Collect time if it is relevant for the analysis.
fields.label: Physical Examination Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PEDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: PETIM
fields.questionText: What was the time of the physical examination?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.PESPID

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
fields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
fields.implementationNotes: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
fields.label: Physical Exam Sponsor-Defined Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: PESPID
fields.questionText: [Sponsor-defined question]

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.PETEST

fields.completionInstructions: Per protocol, perform physical examinations of specified body systems.
fields.definition: Name of the body system.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsors should preprint all body systems to be examined on the CRF. The use of a complete list of body systems eliminates the need for an Other, Specify category; any abnormalities identified would fall under 1 of the specified categories. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Body System" can be included in the column heading.
fields.label: Body System Examined
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable PETESTCD may be determined from the value collected in PETEST.
fields.name: PETEST
fields.questionText: What was the body system examined?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.PERES

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate the overall assessment for each exam category/body system listed.
fields.definition: Overall assessment of examined body system.
fields.implementationNotes: If the examined body system is normal, then the value in PEORRES should be "NORMAL". If the body system is not examined, then the value in PEORRES should be Null and the value in PESTAT should be "NOT DONE". If the examined body system is abnormal, then the value of PEORRES should contain the text of the abnormal findings (PEDESC). If the sponsor's data collection system allows for up-front recording of the abnormality and status using a single variable, then the SDTM variable name PEORRES may be used in place of CDASH variable names PERES and PEDESC. When creating SDTM-based datasets, PESTRESC is the standardized value for PEORRES and is populated for any record where PEORRES is not null. If the abnormal findings are coded using a dictionary, then PESTRESC should be the dictionary preferred term; if not coded, PEORRES.
fields.label: Physical Exam Verbatim Finding
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTMIG variable PEORRES. If PERES="Normal", populate PEORRES with the value of PERES. If PERES="Abnormal", populate PEORRES with the value of PEDESC.
fields.name: PERES
fields.questionText: Were the results normal, abnormal, or not done?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.PEDESC

fields.completionInstructions: Record all abnormal findings for the given body system in the space provided.
fields.definition: Text description of any abnormal findings.
fields.implementationNotes: If the examined body system is normal, then the value in PEORRES should be "NORMAL". If the body system is not examined, then the value in PEORRES should be Null and the value in PESTAT should be "NOT DONE". If the examined body system is abnormal, then the value of PEORRES should contain the text of the abnormal findings (PEDESC). If the sponsor's data collection system allows for up-front recording of the abnormality and status using a single variable, then the SDTM variable name PEORRES may be used in place of CDASH variable names PERES and PEDESC.
fields.label: Physical Exam Abnormal Findings
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTMIG variable PEORRES. If PERES="Normal", populate PEORRES with the value of PERES. If PERES="Abnormal", populate PEORRES with the value of PEDESC.
fields.name: PEDESC
fields.questionText: If the result was abnormal, what were the findings?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.PECLSIG

fields.completionInstructions: Was the physical examination result clinically significant? Select Yes or No.
fields.definition: An indication of whether the physical examination abnormality is clinically significant.
fields.implementationNotes: If this level of information is needed for reconciliation with adverse events, this field may be added to the CRF.
fields.label: Physical Exam Clinical Significance
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPPE dataset as the value of SUPPPE.QVAL where SUPPPE.QNAM ="PECLSIG" and SUPPPE.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: PECLSIG
fields.questionText: Was the physical examination result clinically significant?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.PEEVAL

fields.completionInstructions: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).
fields.definition: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.
fields.implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be pre-printed or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Physical Exam Evaluator
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: PEEVAL
fields.questionText: Who was the evaluator?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.PEREASND

fields.completionInstructions: Provide the reason the assessment was not done.
fields.definition: An explanation of why the data are not available.
fields.implementationNotes: Captures the reason why the measurement or test was not done. The reason may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text.
fields.label: Physical Exam Reason Not Examined
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: PEREASND
fields.questionText: What is the reason that data were not collected?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.PEBODSYS

fields.definition: Body system or organ class that is involved for a finding from the standard hierarchy for dictionary-coded results.
fields.implementationNotes: PEBODSYS should be assigned using a coding system. If included on the CRF, it is prepopulated and must be paired by the sponsor with specific verbatim terms. If not included on the CRF, PEBODSYS is assigned through the coding process.
fields.label: Body System or Organ Class
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: PEBODSYS
fields.questionText: What is/was the [body system/ organ system]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.PEMODIFY

fields.definition: If the value for PEORRES is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.
fields.implementationNotes: This is not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. PEMODIFY contains any modified text used for coding. Used only when the reported abnormalities in PEORRES are coded to a dictionary. This is in contrast to Events and Interventions domains, where the topic variable (TERM or TRT) is modified for coding.
fields.label: Physical Exam Modified Reported Term
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: PEMODIFY

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.PELOC

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate the anatomical location of the abnormal finding.
fields.definition: A description of the anatomical location of the subject, relevant to the collection of physical examination.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
fields.label: Location of Physical Exam Finding
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: PELOC
fields.questionText: What was the anatomical location of the body system examined or the finding?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.PELAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the side of the anatomical location of the abnormal finding.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.
fields.implementationNotes: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Physical Exam Laterality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: PELAT
fields.questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the body system examined or the finding?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.PEDIR

fields.completionInstructions: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the abnormal finding.
fields.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Physical Exam Directionality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: PEDIR
fields.questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the of the body system examined or the finding?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99075

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.PEPORTOT

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate the proportionality of the anatomical location of the of the abnormal finding.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of).
fields.implementationNotes: Collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific portionality for the anatomical locations. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: PE Location Portion or Totality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: PEPORTOT
fields.questionText: What was the portion or totality of the anatomical location of the body system examined or the finding?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C85492

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

priorVersion.title: PE Method of Test or Examination

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Traditional.PEMETHOD

self.title: PE Method of Test or Examination

fields.completionInstructions: Record the method of test or examination.
fields.definition: Method of the test or examination.
fields.implementationNotes: This information may be collected when more than 1 method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary.
fields.label: PE Method of Test or Examination
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: PEMETHOD
fields.questionText: What was the method used for the test or examination?
